data.enText: spirit of person
the spiritual part of a person, believed to exist after death

data.chText: 他认为他不死的灵魂有堕入地狱的危险。
data.enText: He believed his immortal soul was in peril.

data.chText: 怒吼的风如同堕入地狱的灵魂在哀声恸哭。
data.enText: The howling wind sounded like the wailing of lost souls (= the spirits of dead people who are not in heaven) .
inner character
a person's inner character, containing their true thoughts and feelings

data.chText: 她内心深处感到焦躁不安。
data.enText: There was a feeling of restlessness deep in her soul.

data.chText: 精神 / 道德 / 艺术品质
data.enText: spiritual/moral/artistic qualities

data.chText: （人类整体的）精神状况，道德品质
data.enText: the spiritual and moral qualities of humans in general

data.chText: 人类精神世界中阴暗的一面
data.enText: the dark side of the human soul

data.chText: 真挚情感；高尚情操；气魄
data.enText: strong and good human feeling, especially that gives a work of art its quality or enables sb to recognize and enjoy that quality

data.chText: 这场演出技艺很精湛，但缺少真挚的情感。
data.enText: It was a very polished performance, but it lacked soul.
a perfect example of a good quality
He is the soul of discretion.
person
a person of a particular type

data.chText: 可怜的人，她的钱全没了。
data.enText: She's lost all her money, poor soul.
You're a brave soul.
a person
There wasn't a soul in sight (= nobody was in sight) .
Don't tell a soul (= do not tell anyone) .
a village of 300 souls (= with 300 people living there)
music
soul music

data.chText: 灵乐，灵歌（感情强烈，源于非洲裔美国人的音乐）
data.enText: a type of music that expresses strong emotions, made popular by African American musicians
a soul singer
good for the soul
good for you, even if it seems unpleasant

data.chText: “搭车吗？”“不，谢谢。步行有步行的好处。”
data.enText: ‘Want a ride?’ ‘No thanks. Walking is good for the soul.’
bare your soul (to sb)
to tell sb your deepest and most private feelings
body and soul
with all your energy

data.chText: 她全心全意为这一事业而奋斗。
data.enText: She committed herself body and soul to fighting for the cause.
God rest his/her soul
God rest him/her
used to show respect when you are talking about sb who is dead
heart and soul

data.chText: 满腔热忱干劲十足；全心全意
data.enText: with a lot of energy and enthusiasm

data.chText: 他们全心全意地投入了这个项目。
data.enText: They threw themselves heart and soul into the project.

data.id-g-sent: the life and soul of the party etc.

data.enText: sell your soul (to the devil)
to do anything, even sth bad or dishonest, in return for money, success or power

means: (人类整体的)精神状况，道德品质

data.enText: good for the soul
good for you, even if it seems unpleasant

data.chText: “搭车吗？”“不，谢谢。步行有步行的好处。”
data.enText: ‘Want a ride?’ ‘No thanks. Walking is good for the soul.’
bare your soul (to sb)
to tell sb your deepest and most private feelings
body and soul
with all your energy

data.chText: 她全心全意为这一事业而奋斗。
data.enText: She committed herself body and soul to fighting for the cause.
God rest his/her soul
God rest him/her
used to show respect when you are talking about sb who is dead
heart and soul

data.chText: 满腔热忱干劲十足；全心全意
data.enText: with a lot of energy and enthusiasm

data.chText: 他们全心全意地投入了这个项目。
data.enText: They threw themselves heart and soul into the project.
the life and soul of the party, etc.

data.chText: （聚会等场合）最活跃风趣的人
data.enText: the most amusing and interesting person at a party, etc.
sell your soul (to the devil)
to do anything, even sth bad or dishonest, in return for money, success or power

example: there was too much for one person to do

tr: a secular form of gospel that was a major Black musical genre in the 1960s and 1970s
example: soul was politically significant during the Civil Rights movement

tr: the immaterial part of a person
the actuating cause of an individual life

value.def: Your soul is the part of you that consists of your mind, character, thoughts, and feelings. Many people believe that your soul continues existing after your body is dead.

example.ex: She went to pray for the soul of her late husband...
example.tran: 她去为亡夫的灵魂祈祷。

example.ex: 'I will put my heart and soul into the job,' he promises.
example.tran: “我会全身心投入到工作中去，”他保证说。

value.def: The soul of a nation or a political movement is its basic nature and beliefs.

example.ex: ...a struggle for the soul of the Republican Party.
example.tran: 为实现共和党的基本宗旨而进行的奋斗

value.tran: (民族或政治运动的)精神，精髓

value.def: You can refer to someone as a particular kind of soul when you are describing their character or condition.

example.ex: Her mother, poor soul, came to an even worse end.
example.tran: 她的母亲，那个可怜的人，结局更糟糕。

value.def: You use soul in negative statements like not a soul to mean nobody at all.

example.ex: I've never harmed a soul in my life...
example.tran: 我这一生从未伤害过任何人。

example.ex: There was not a soul there.

value.tran: (用于否定句中)一个人(也没有)

value.def: Soul or soul music is a type of pop music performed mainly by black American musicians. It developed from gospel and blues music and often expresses deep emotions.

example.tran: 美国灵乐歌手安妮塔·贝克

value.tran: 灵乐(一种主要由美国黑人音乐家表演的流行音乐，源出福音唱诗及布鲁斯乐曲)

value.def: You can refer to the number of people who live in a particular place as souls .

example.tran: 一个只有 100 位居民的小村庄

value.def: If you say that someone sells their soul, you mean that they do something immoral or bad in order to get something they want such as success or money.

example.ex: ...politicians who would sell their soul for the sake of office.
example.tran: 为了谋求官位而不择手段的政客

value.tran: 出卖灵魂;做违背良心的事

xrse.def: to keep body and soul together
the life and soul of the party

trans: 美国南方黑人的传统食物
灵乐(一种主要由美国黑人音乐家表演的流行音乐，源出福音唱诗及布鲁斯乐曲)
